ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Regardless of what some of the other reviews say, I enjoyed this class. The readings are incredibly interesting, and you will definitely get a better idea of what leadership has been defined as at various times. I never realized that political leadership was such a complicated concept until I took this class.
Sure, it's very interesting. The grading is harsh though, so be prepared to have a drop in your GPA.

If you already have a particular leadership case you are interested in, this class will give you the tools to explore it further. The class is just one paper with multiple drafts and you need to lock down a case study topic pretty early. The readings are extremely general so I found most of the academic value in the class through the independent research. Because the readings were so general, I found discussion to be less fruitful. Skowronek is very helpful in the paper writing process though and will help you make a strong argument in your case study
